items.message: The Flood Alert for South London is no longer in force. Significant rainfall fell over South London during the past 15 hours. The risk of flooding has now passed with only light showers expected for Friday the 26th of August and Saturday the 27th of August.

items.description: River Rythe from Oxshott to Thames Ditton

items.message: The Flood Alert for South London is no longer in force. Significant rainfall fell over South London during the past 15 hours. The risk of flooding has now passed with only light showers expected for Friday the 26th of August and Saturday the 27th of August.

This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. 
No further rainfall is forecast over the coming days.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

items.description: The upper Stour and surrounding tributaries
items.message: Levels are now below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no further significant rainfall today or tomorrow.. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.
